page.title: 09Shottisham: Description
page.content: {Shottisham}is an old established village between Woodbridge and Bawdsey. The only shop is a{General {Store + Post Office.}There is a mobile shop selling hardware goods which tours the village on a Wed. The only industry is a{Farriers}and a {Tool Maker + Precision Engineers.}A small housing development by a local builder is taking place. The{church}of St. Margaret overlooks the surrounding land which is mostly arable. The village is served by a privately owned bus service. On the outskirts of the village there is an old mill which has been converted into a private house. In 1928 a branch of the Women's Institute was formed; members meet monthly on a Wed. afternoon in the {Trust Hall.
